docs.lead_paragraph: DOCTORS have long tried to find new uses for old drugs, and in this quest centuries may pass before someone discovers hidden benefits in standard medications. Yet even when important new uses are found, it may be decades before the benefits are confirmed and widely recommended. A case in point is aspirin, which is one of the oldest and most commonly used drugs. In a new use documented only in recent years, aspirin is now recommended for millions of Americans who are at risk for the prevention and treatment of heart attacks and strokes.

headline.main: Little-Known Doctor Who Found New Use For Common Aspirin
